channel.title: Headless Browsers
channel.description:
I've used Selenium with it's python bindings, and I really liked how it gave me direct access to the DOM. But it wasn't truly headless.
Just recently I played around with Awesomium and while it was truly headless it was a pain in the arse to get access to the DOM. I was using the .NET bindings, and the only way to get easy access is using a dynamic variable after making a call to JS to get some form of element from the page.
So my question is (for those of you with the experience): is there any framework out there that makes it easier? I would like to keep it 100% headless

item.title: Headless Browsers
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

RSCShadow:

http://phantomjs.org/

I’ve thought about this, and maybe next time I will give it a go. I originally skipped over it because I didn’t want to use JS, but I didn’t realize they’ve had webdriver support for a long time.

Read full topic
